intro: Tournefortia paniculata var. austrina, commonly known as the Australian tournefortia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its erect, often branched shrub form. The plant produces showy, fragrant yellow flowers arranged in paniculate inflorescences. Its leaves are typically ovate to elliptic, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and inland regions of Australia.
